bugs.title: CVE-2023-6346 CVE-2023-6347 CVE-2023-6350 CVE-2023-6351 chromium: various flaws [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-6346 CVE-2023-6347 CVE-2023-6350 CVE-2023-6351 chromium: various flaws [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-6347 chromium-browser: Use after free in Mojo

long_desc.thetext:
An use after free flaw was found in the Mojo component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1494461

External References:

http://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_28.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2252009]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2252008]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-6346 chromium-browser: Use after free in WebAudio

long_desc.thetext:
An use after free flaw was found in the WebAudio component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1500856

External References:

http://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_28.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2252009]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2252008]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-6350 chromium-browser: Out of bounds memory access in libavif

long_desc.thetext:
An out of bounds memory access flaw was found in the libavif component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1501766

External References:

http://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_28.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2252009]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2252008]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-6351 chromium-browser: Use after free in libavif

long_desc.thetext:
An use after free flaw was found in the libavif component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1501770

External References:

http://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_28.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2252009]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2252008]

More information about these security flaws is available in the following bugs:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2252007
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2252005
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2252006
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2252004

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2252004,2252005,2252006,2252007,2252009

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

Integer overflow in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 119.0.6045.199 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a malicious file. (Chromium security severity: High)

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_28.html
https://crbug.com/1505053

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2252188]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2252189]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2252187

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2252187,2252188

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

bugs.title: CVE-2023-6348 chromium: chromium-browser: Type Confusion in Spellcheck [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-6348 chromium: chromium-browser: Type Confusion in Spellcheck [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-6348 chromium-browser: Type Confusion in Spellcheck

long_desc.thetext:
Type Confusion in Spellcheck in Google Chrome prior to 119.0.6045.199 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_28.html
https://crbug.com/1491459

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2252191]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2252192]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2252190

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2252190,2252191

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

notes:
update to 119.0.6045.199, upstream security release
